The student will demonstrate knowledge of the economic, social, and politicatransformation of the United States and the world between the end of World War II and
the present by

C5978D53F88E4C11943715D24970A025.description:

B5B5C8041D65415680F5542064CE3E0B.description: The student will demonstrate knowledge of the social, economic, and technological changes of the early twentieth century by

5968C6C6507B4E70B6C1E1D590FD32CC.description:

2520837C33B849EFA60CE7CD5042F8A2.description:

c) examining art, literature, and music from the 1920s and 1930s, with emphasis on
Langston Hughes, Duke Ellington, Georgia O’Keeffe, and the Harlem Renaissance.

21CA6B628AF84AA78F40E430B48F71A2.description:
b) describing the social and economic changes that took place, including prohibition
and the Great Migration north and west;

F8243DB0AB4F4CABA575279C8C44E8B6.description:

8C1E32FFD1524BEE849809D17F8A0383.description: describing Theodore Roosevelt’s impact on the foreign policy of the United States;

5BDFF70BB442459CA8F3BB13D78245BC.description: explaining the reasons for and results of the Spanish American War;

EA9BBB0F986345A5BE973ABC325A7F3B.description:

CC7740AFFAF846A592BFA055A071BE01.description:
explaining the impact of new inventions, the rise of big business, the growth of

17319C97C0194FCCBD27EE8704DE091A.description:

BD99373A0EAC45F8A7A9E1A0206F6309.description:
explaining the reasons for the increase in immigration, growth of cities, and

1A08FBEF5C394566BEA89EF042CD7590.description: The student will demonstrate knowledge of how life changed after the Civil War by

C535937893734BDDB7E4C354B2AA168D.description: describing the legacies of Abraham Lincoln, Robert E. Lee, and Frederick Douglass.

697F6BA4C33244288B92A0C5F585C063.description: describing the impact of Reconstruction policies on the South and North;

D3A9519B189E4EB68BCD446FBC4414AC.description: explaining how the issues of states’ rights and slavery increased sectional tensions;

E8550158E3B24177A62A2260EB82BAFB.description: describing the cultural, economic, and constitutional issues that divided the nation;

90FE7E48ADA34684B728909D270F7980.description: The student will demonstrate knowledge of the causes, major events, and effects of the Civil War by

ED45C1401C4A46B58F30E824FDA9DE09.description:

06A9B814B67246B690222C4082D29D14.description:

settlements, including Cactus Hill in Virginia.

3434E75A4C744976809F7825A7124B9C.description:

0B529ACBC2CA4A34AC1D5F3D356F5378.description:
identifying the impact of Virginians, such as Woodrow Wilson and George C.

5CDDDFE00F5342179315603818F64182.description:
describing the roles played by whites, enslaved African Americans, free African
Americans, and American Indians.

3EB2189E64574480B8592CE169C66DA3.description:
describing Virginia’s role in the war, including identifying major battles that took

D7B69A9E38574FE994DE961141EAD7A1.description:
